epic.basic

Class BasicSIRObserver

  • java.lang.Object
    • broadwick.stochastic.Observer
      • epic.basic.BasicSIRObserver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<broadwick.stochastic.Observer>

    public class BasicSIRObserver
extends broadwick.stochastic.Observer
    BasicSIRObserver writes model state information to an output log file if the filename (fname) is set BasicSIRObserver writes model state information to the log.info stream about the BasicSIR model if printToLogInfo = true
    Version:
    9 April 2014
    Author:
    Samantha Lycett

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BasicSIRObserver(broadwick.stochastic.StochasticSimulator sim)
      Comments from Observer class Creates an observer dedicated to one process.
      BasicSIRObserver(broadwick.stochastic.StochasticSimulator sim, String fname)
      Creates an observer dedicated to one process (but this observer is not registered at the process, you have to do that separately) also opens a log file for the model output with the filename = fname

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void finished()
      closes the log file output if it is open
      void observeEvent(broadwick.stochastic.SimulationEvent event, double tau, int times)
      Gets called BEFORE an event is triggered.
      void setPrintToLogInfo(boolean p)
      sets the flag to print to log.info or not
      void started()
      start the observer - writes the initial state to the output log file if not null and optionally prints to screen
      void step()
      Gets called AFTER event.
      void theta(double thetaTime, Collection<Object> events)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicSIRObserver

        public BasicSIRObserver(broadwick.stochastic.StochasticSimulator sim)
        Comments from Observer class Creates an observer dedicated to one process. The observer is NOT registered at the process, you have to call Simulator.addObserver(Observer) in order to do this.
        Parameters:
        sim - the process

      • BasicSIRObserver

        public BasicSIRObserver(broadwick.stochastic.StochasticSimulator sim,
                String fname)
        Creates an observer dedicated to one process (but this observer is not registered at the process, you have to do that separately) also opens a log file for the model output with the filename = fname
        Parameters:
        sim -
        fname -

        sets the flag to print to log.info or not

      • started

        public void started()
        start the observer - writes the initial state to the output log file if not null and optionally prints to screen
        Specified by:
        started in class broadwick.stochastic.Observer

      • step

        public void step()
        Gets called AFTER event. This observer records the state of the BasicSIR model - writes to file and prints to log.info
        Specified by:
        step in class broadwick.stochastic.Observer

      • finished

        public void finished()
        closes the log file output if it is open

      • observeEvent

        public void observeEvent(broadwick.stochastic.SimulationEvent event,
                double tau,
                int times)
        Gets called BEFORE an event is triggered. Has no effect in this implementation, apart from to optionally print to log.info
        Specified by:
        observeEvent in class broadwick.stochastic.Observer
        Parameters:
        event - the event which is supposed to fire
        tau - the time the event occurs
        times - the number of firings
